title: Georgia could require cash bail for 30 more crimes, including many misdemeanors
description: Georgia, once a self-proclaimed leader in criminal justice reform, is sliding a little further toward its old lock-'em-up ways. State senators voted 30-17 on Thursday to require cash bail for 30 additional crimes,

title: Argentina economy
description: Argentina is divided over the new president's plans for its troubled economy. A court has suspended labour reforms brought in by newly elected Argentine president, Javier Milei. It had been due in a few days to join the group, seen as a counterweight to the Western-led world.

title: Ex-Labour MP who sent explicit texts to teen girl to stand as Reform candidate
description: Simon Danczuk, who was suspended for “inappropriate” behaviour towards the 17-year-old student, is the “right candidate” to tackle Rochdale’s grooming gangs, according to leader Richard Tice

title: Former Rochdale MP Simon Danczuk is standing in a by-election for his old seat
description: Former Rochdale MP Simon Danczuk has announced he is seeking to reclaim his old seat in Parliament. The ex-Labour MP will represent Reform UK - the party founded by former UKIP leader Nigel Farage - at the Rochdale by-election later this month.

title: Former Labour MP Simon Danczuk switches to Nigel Farage's Reform for Rochdale byelection
description: Former Labour MP Simon Danczuk, who was blocked from running for Labour in 2017 after an explicit texting scandal, is standing as the candidate for Nigel Farage's Reform Party

title: Senate to vote next week on bipartisan border bill, Schumer says
description: Top Senate Democrat gives timetable for vote on border security bill tied to Ukraine aid as Trump urges lawmakers to reject deal

title: Reform UK accepted donations from Crispin Odey despite sexual assault allegations
description: The right-wing party Reform UK accepted a political donation from disgraced financier Crispin Odey two months after he was accused of sexual misconduct.

title: ‘Height of stupidity’: Dan Crenshaw calls out GOP lawmakers on border reform bill
description: Rep. Dan Crenshaw (R-TX) criticized lawmakers in his own party for trying to ‘torpedo’ a potential border reform bill. CNN’s Manu Raju reports.

title: ‘Dark day for politics’: MP Mike Freer’s constituents’ shock at decision to quit
description: Justice minister Mike Freer is stepping down as MP for Finchley and Golders Green after death threats, abuse and intimidation

description: Alternative provision in England is in “desperate need of reform” amid “systemic issues” that lead to “inconsistent outcomes” for young people, two watchdogs have said in a critical report today.

title: ‘I don’t know how I will eat.’ For the workers behind Argentina’s national drink, Milei’s reforms are turning sour

title: DUP tensions over Stormont deal exposed as peer says sea border concerns remain
description: Former deputy leader of the DUP Lord Dodds of Duncairn suggested there was a divergence of views within the party.

title: Committee says major reforms into Council funding are needed
description: THE Government needs to make major reforms to how local councils are funded to prevent authorities from facing financial collapse. These are the findings of a cross-party committee of MPs, who say a £4 billion funding gap needs to be plugged to prevent councils across the country from going bankrupt.

title: Rochdale by-election: former Labour MP Simon Danczuk bids to become Rochdale's first Reform MP
description: Former Rochdale MP Simon Danczuk is trying his hand at becoming the town’s MP again, by standing for Reform UK.

title: Sexting shame MP Simon Danczuk - who exited the Commons amid an explicit messages scandal - plots return to Parliament as Reform UK's candidate at Rochdale by-election
description: The 57-year-old is hoping to be re-elected to the seat he held for Labour between 2010 and 2017 when local voters go to the polls at the end of this month.

title: Could Local Councils In England Really Go Bankrupt? Here's What You Need To Know`
description: MPs have warned that severe government underfunding poses a severe risk to local councils in England. A cross-party committee estimates that there is a £4bn funding gap for the 2024-25 – and suggested councils could go “bust” as a result.

description: Research by Redfield & Wilton Strategies suggested the Nigel Farage-founded party is picking up significant support in the crucial election battleground.

title: Bradford referenced in major report on how councils are funded
description: Funding model for local councils broken' The committee is made up of both Conservative and Labour MPs, and Clive Betts, Labour chair of the committee said: “Long-term reform is vitally needed. “The funding model for local councils is broken.”

title: Student body declares Scotland’s university and college system ‘broken’
description: The National Union of Students Scotland has set out its own vision for a new, improved system in a paper called Broke Students, Broken System.

title: Former Labour MP Simon Danczuk is standing as Reform candidate in the Rochdale by-election
description: Former Labour MP Simon Danczuk is standing as the Reform Party’s candidate in the Rochdale by-election. Mr Danczuk, who represented the seat from 2010 to 2017 and helped expose the Rochdale grooming scandal has defected to the Richard Tice-led party ahead of the poll.

title: Out of area taxi working to be banned if Labour win election, says Andy Burnham
description: ‘Out of area’ taxi working would be banned under Labour, Andy Burnham has said. Mr Burnham, speaking on his regular BBC Radio Manchester ‘in the hot seat’ phone in, also said he had verbal confirmation from Louise Haigh, shadow transport minister, that the practice would be stopped.

title: Reform UK unveil ex-Labour MP as their candidate in Rochdale by-election
description: Reform UK has pulled off a shock coup after announcing their candidate for the upcoming Rochdale by-election will be none other than the constituency’s former Labour MP. Simon Danczuk will stand for Richard Tice’s party, after a by-election was called following the passing of incumbent MP Sir Tony Loyd a fortnight ago.

description: Mid Bedfordshire MP Alistair Strathern is calling for action to help residents who’ve been waiting years for roads to be adopted by the council.

title: GMP 3% uprating order approved in parliament
description: The annual uprating order for GMPs has been approved at 3% after a parliamentary session yesterday (31 January).
